venue.name: Maine Audubon - Gilsland Farm Audubon Center

item.description:
Fall is the best time to create your no-dig garden beds!

Maine Audubon invites you to join Portland Maine Permaculture organizer Lisa Fernandes for an evening slideshow and discussion on how to create and maintain no-dig garden beds to foster living, biologically active soils.  Gardening in this fashion mimics the natural patterns of soil and fertility creation and results in healthier plants and animals as well as more nutritious food for all.

The evening will include a slideshow, handouts, discussion of options and materials, the pros and cons of this method.

Attendees will leave inspired to create their own no-dig gardens now, before the snow flies, so that the gardens will be ready to plant in spring with no tilling required!

More details and directions at the Audubon site if needed:  http://maineaudubon.org/events/2012/maine-audubon-speaker-series-3/

group.name: Portland Maine Permaculture & The Resilience Hub

item.name: Ecology Beneath our Feet: No-Dig Gardening for Healthy Food & Ecosystems
